content:
Note that on #Friendica we canquote-share, and we can also do it in comments. As I discovered recently by playing in the below post
â™² @Liwott@lemmy.ml:

Do your commenting tests here.


While posting tests can obsviously be made on this community without further precision, commenting requires a post to comment on. This is what this post is for.
these make it through to #Lemmy when we do it in a comment, but not in a top-level post (which is already a great start !). So, in Friendica, all that's missing is the backlink !
Also the Linked Data nature of the underlying data would make it possible to create all different kinds of associations, not just a plain cross-ref link.
This seems interesting, but I must say I don't directly see an application of this in the context of microblogging/commenting. Maybe you can inspire us here? ðŸ˜€

Do your commenting tests here.


While posting tests can obsviously be made on this community without further precision, commenting requires a post to comment on. This is what this post is for.
these make it through to #Lemmy when we do it in a comment, but not in a top-level post (which is already a great start !). So, in Friendica, all that's missing is the backlink !
Also the Linked Data nature of the underlying data would make it possible to createall different kinds of associations, not just a plain cross-ref link.
This seems interesting, but I must say I don't directly see an application of this in the context of microblogging/commenting. Maybe you can inspire us here? ðŸ˜€

source.content:
Note that on #[url=https://nerdica.net/search?tag=Friendica]Friendica[/url] we can quote-share, and we can also do it in comments. As I discovered recently by playing in the below post
[share author='Liwott' profile='https://lemmy.ml/u/Liwott' avatar='' link='https://lemmy.ml/post/241819' posted='2022-04-23 14:34:19' guid='44b525e5-4101b003e005e70a-d472d963'][h3]Do your commenting tests here.[/h3]
While posting tests can obsviously bemade on this community without further precision, commenting requires a post to comment on. This is what this post is for.[/share]
these make it through to #[url=https://nerdica.net/search?tag=Lemmy]Lemmy[/url] when we do it in a comment, but not in a top-level post (which is already a great start !).So, in Friendica, all that's missing is the backlink !
[quote]Also the Linked Data nature of the underlying data would make it possible to create all different kinds of associations, not just a plain cross-ref link.[/quote]
This seems interesting, but I must say I don't directly see an application ofthis in the context of microblogging/commenting. Maybe you can inspire us here? :)
